Besides seeing and enjoying the wildlife, you can also spend some quality time with your loved ones here. These national (Read More)parks in Delhi are a treat to the eyes for the nature lovers and wildlife lovers. Here is the list of 3 National Parks in Delhi For A Wild Holiday 1. National Zoological Park, Delhi 4.3 /5 View 18+ photos Inaugurated in 1959, National Zoological Park is situated near The Old Fort in Delhi and is a favourite weekend spot among adults and children alike. From biggest cats to the tiniest birds, the zoo has all kinds of animals and birds. Initially, it was known as Delhi Zoo when in 1982 it was renamed The National Zoological Park with the idea of making it the model zoo of the country. Read More 2. Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary, Gurgaon 4.0 /5 A perfect weekend getaway from Delhi, Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary is an amazing escape, especially for nature lovers and birding enthusiasts. It is home to a number of migratory birds and is a great spot for spotting the various species, especially during winters. Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary is located at a distance of 40 kilometres from Dhaula-Kuan in Delhi on the Gurgaon-Farukh Nagar Road. Read More 3. Deer Park, Delhi, Delhi Popularly known as the "lungs of Delhi", Deer Park is a verdant green park situated in the heart of the very crowded Hauz Khas Village area of New Delhi. Consisting of a deer park, duck park, art market, rabbit fields, fountain, lake and an enclosed old heritage monument area, the park is a common favourite and a respite among Delhites looking for a break from the pollution and dust of the city. Read More National Parks are loved by people of all age groups. You can plan a whole day's trip to these parks with your friends and family as most of the national parks in Delhi have become popular picnic spots. However, National Parks are more important for the conservation of wildlife and more parks should be brought up across the country.
